content.formatted_body:
// Allowed
@foo
@foo()
@foo.bar()
@(foo['bar']('baz'))

// Not allowed
@foo().bar
@(foo).bar
@foo['bar']

// Not sure yet
@(foo['bar'])()
@this.#x()

content.body: bakkot: i think fundamentally, almost all things in Intl are library-y, because it's a really a library. the main driving factor from my POV for "it's worth it to ship in the language" has been "runtimes ship all this data anyway let's put it to good use", with "it'd be good to have a standard" with a secondary
